content: the easy ear warmer thank you for choosing hooked on aard as your pattern of choice i hope you enjoyed making this earwarmer as much as i did hookedonaard@gmail com hooked on aard @hooked_on_aard let s get hooked stuffs to know before you start read through the entire pattern before you get started to ensure you know what is required of you this pattern is written in us terms with metric measurements the ch1/2/3 at the start of a row always counts as a st unless stated otherwise this pattern is worked in row i do allow people to make and sell items with this pattern please do not change the name or sell this pattern or parts of this pattern as your own always credit the creator for their work please consider the environment before printing this pattern materials needed stitches and abbreviations about 30g of dk weight yarn of st - stitch/es choice space - space 4 00mm hook chain - chain scissors slip_stitch - slip_stitch yarn needle skip - skip single_crochet - single_crochet pictured charity dk in silver double_crochet - double_crochet crdc - cross double_crochet - see stitch explanations below fo - fasten_off - create st between in the same st/space ** - repeat st between ** gauge and measurements you will need to take the following measurements 1 head circumference stitch explanations crdc - cross double_crochet note this stitch is worked over two stitches sk1 double_crochet in the next st double_crochet into the skip st written instructions create a chain that is 2cm shorter than your head circumference measurement note - this chain must be an uneven number r1 starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet in each st across ch1 and turn note - you should have an even number of single_crochet after r1 r2 single_crochet in each st across ch1 and turn r3 single_crochet in each st across ch2 and turn r4 crdc across until 1 st remains double_crochet in the last st ch1 and turn r5 single_crochet in each st across ch2 and turn r6 *sk1 single_crochet double_crochet in the next st* until 2 st remain sk1 single_crochet in the last st ch2 and turn r7 single_crochet double_crochet in each single_crochet from the previous r single_crochet in the last st ch2 and turn repeat r7 6 more times ch1 and turn r14 single_crochet in each st across ch2 and turn r15 repeat r4 r16 - 18 repeat r2 to create the twist https //www youtube com/watch v=akic1asm0za fo and weave in all ends thank you for your support yay you have just created your easy ear warmer please remember to tag me on your socials @hooked_on_aard and #hooked_on_aard i d love to see your versions about hooked on aard aard is my brainchild it represents who i am and what i believe in as an afrikaans south african aard closely resembles aarde which is the afrikaans word for earth i have a passion for all things nature and through crochet i
